boardgame.name: Barbe Noire
Blackbeard
boardgame.description: Introduction (from the rule book):_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;BLACKBEARD recreates _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;The Golden Age of Piracy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; at the turn of the 18th century. Each player becomes one or more pirates and attempts to amass a fortune and retire before a King's Commissioner tracks him down, a Warship stumbles across him, or his own crew cuts his throat! Merchant ships plying the trade routes are the targets. Prizes range from near-worthless supplies to the fabulous Spanish and Mogul treasure ships. Luck, skill and cunning all play a part as you comb the Seven Seas (well ... at least three of them) for fame and fortune. Players should be aware that the game simulates 18th century piracy and therefore features random happenstance. Little can be planned. Players who are ready to strike when opportunity presents itself and are wily and aggressive without being rash will fare best in the long run._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players take up the roles of famous pirates navigating the major sea lanes during the golden age of piracy. Plunder and pirateering await as each player moves about on the map in a variable system through a deck of cards. Rather than the normal turn order in games, players move when their designation is drawn in a deck. When not in the role of their pirate they can take on the role of one of the English military ships hunting the sea for pirates. By making shrewd choices and having some luck the player can end the game a wealthy and retired pirate with a large fleet of ships that have been accumulated over the years._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1991 Origins Awards Best Pre-20th Century Boardgame Winner

This game is in excellent condition and has a significant bonus, please read on. The box is square, no fading, no dents or splits, only some minor rubbing on the corners. The rules are in good condition having been read but no splits tears or significant marks. The counters are all in good condition and have been broken out (sadly I can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t verify that they are complete as the content list states two sheets of counters, but I have no reason to believe that any are missing). The map boards are in good shape no splits or marks. The original dice are included one white and one coloured (brown!). All the cards are in excellent shape. The major bonus with this set is that it has double the number of Pirate Cards (48 in place of 24), Action Cards (80 in place of 40)and ship logs (16 in place of 8). One of the sets of ship cards haven_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t been broken out yet. Please feel free to ask for more information or pictures.

Hi! Thanks for looking. Game + General (AH) magazine The game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Blackbeard_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; from Avalon Hill on sale here is definitely in good condition; perhaps even very good? The box is only slightly worn at the corners with no splits, and with only a slight depression at the top-front on the face of the box causing very minor creasing/indentation. The game has not been played, although all the ship counters are punched and sorted into the game tray - two dice are included. The contents, that is, counters, map, playing cards, rules and so on, are as new. I am also including the relevant _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;General_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; magazine with the sale (volume 27, Number 6 - the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Blackbeard_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; issue), which has several articles covering the game. Additionally, a couple of printouts of game errata, which I got from the internet, come with the sale too. This is a good buy for anyone wanting the complete game. I will post anywhere in the world (buyer pays cost). I will use Australia Post with the cost converted to U.S. dollars and cents (exchange rate information via XE.com). I accept payment via paypal only, with U.S. currency as the medium of exchange. Wish you a good purchase!
